column1: a little bit of shape away, full, and Warner defends this
full, outside off, and he leaves as it swings away
full, and he eases this towards cover. Wants a single, but it travels quickly to Williamson
length, angles in with the arm this time, and he defends
full, angles into him, and he looks to go towards midwicket. Takes the outer edge, but runs away along the ground towards point
leading edge, but short of third slip! Fuller ball, and Warner has a little nibble, but with soft hands. It runs along the ground and lands just short of Neesham
length, and he jams down on this as it moves away a touch. Defended towards short cover
little shorter, and wider, and he drives but cannot beat cover

fuller, and he drives, and Guptill cannot hang on to a tough chance! Fielding at short cover, he gets across to his right, and just fingertips it away. it was hit with some power, a length ball outside off
full ball, drives it to short cover
full, outside off, and he drives this towards short cover
full ball, and he drives this straight back down the pitch
angles into him, and he plays it with soft hands down towards short midwicket, and they set off for the first run in 13 balls!
length, shapes away from Finch with the natural angle and he shoulders arms
full, on the pads, and he whips it away down towards midwicket. Neesham does well to keep it from reaching the fence
full, on off stump, and he defends
length, angles away from him, and he runs this down to third man
full ball, on the pads, and he has whipped this off his pads, up the slope, through for four. Easy putaway in the end, because it didn't swing
wide outside off, and he throws his bat at this. Takes a bounce on its way down to third man
length, straighter, and tucks him up as he looks to play it on the onside, but misses out on contact
full, and he throws his bat at this. Hits it hard, but cover stops this
length, shapes into him, and he jams his bat down in time to play it away towards square leg
full, on the pads, and he looks to whip it away on the on side. Off his pads towards square leg
full, and he comes forward in trying to drive this past cover. Finds the player there
length, outside off, defended towards point
full, and he drives this straight back past Boult! Beats mid on with the placement, and the power on it has Boult dropping down to his right in a vain attempt at stopping that

length, and jags back into him and traps him in front! Just a bit of seam movement back into him, and Finch shakes his head as he walks off. The umpire was fairly easily convinced that this would have hit the top of off and middle, and the Australia captain agreed. What a start for New Zealand!
length, outside off, and he defends
DROPPED! Full ball outside off, and Khawaja goes with the flow and has a dab at it, taking one hand off. It goes through to Guptill at the second of three slips, but he spills it as he falls
thrown wide, and he cuts, but cannot beat point
full, outside off, and he drives this to mid off
length, outside off, and he drives to the left of mid off. Wants a single, but the fielder was quick to converge on this
full, slanting across him, and he drives it to mid off
looks to go full, but goes down the leg side
full, angles across him, and he again times a drive well, but cannot place it either side of mid off
length, angles away, and goes close to his gloves before nipping away through to Latham behind the wicket
full, but on the pads, and he can whip this off his legs towards deep midwicket. Ferguson does well to keep the scoring down to two
off-cutter, comes into him at 143kph from a length, and he fends it towards square leg
short, angles away from him, and gets big as he looks to cut! Just clears point, and trundles away towards the point fence. They are able to come back for two, but that was not far from Nicholls
length, honing in on off stump, and he defends
short, and he picks it up from outside off and whips it towards deep square leg. Smart shot, as a little roll of the wrists kept it to the left of short midwicket
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, and he defends
length, angles across him, and he defends this towards point
shimmies across the crease to the off side, and CdG follows him, throwing it wide. He drives, but cover dives to his right and stops this
length, angling away, and he dabs this down to third man with soft hands
full, outside off, and he smashes this past mid off. Hit hard, but also placed well to the left of the man there
length, angles across him, and he seems surprised by the lack of pace on this 125kph ball. Plays it on to his pads off the inside edge
length, and some extra bounce as he looks to defend. Immediately signals to the dressing room with his gloves. Would hope that is just for water, or drier gloves perhaps?
length, outside off, and he defends this to point
full, on the pads, and he flicks this past short midwicket. There's a man in the deep who will get to this on his right, but they will return for the second
throws this a bit wider, fuller, and he drives as it swings away from him. Goes straight to point
full, on the pads, and he can tuck this away towards long leg. The man at deep backward square leg cannot get across to this
full, outside off, and he drives this just out of the reach of cover. They will get two as the fielder half-stops it
full, and driven towards point

short, and he has got Warner with a snorter! Delivered at 142kph, and following him as he looks to sway out of its way, this ball takes off and takes Warner along its way through to Latham. Ferguson had no doubt, and neither did Warner. Both openers dismissed this early, wow!
length, jags into him, and he forces himself to come forward and just defend
length, angles into him again, and he plays it away towards point
full ball, and he drives this towards point. Able to get past the man there, but cover runs along and keeps it from reaching the boundary
shorter, angles into him, and he defends this towards cover. 146kph!
length, and he defends this 145kph ball angling into him
bouncer which Khawaja tries to hook away, but he's gonna need a stepladder for that. The Lord's hospitality doesn't quite go that far

beats him again! This time with good old fashioned line and length outside off. Khawaja has this habit of reaching out away from his body - because he rarely moves his feet, especially forward. And that time there's just enough away movement to beat the edge
goes for the magic ball, pitching leg and swinging away to take the leading edge. No such luck as Khawaja flicks the ball on the pads to deep square leg
goes round the stumps straight away to SS, who is only too happy to work with the angle and flick the fuller delivery from outside off down the ground past the right of the bowler
gets across his stumps because he reads the short ball early and knows there's a sprawling gap at long leg. Good pull game plan. Good pull shot
stays over the wicket - with no mid-off - and pitches the ball up on middle stump. Smith springs across and then, after teasing all of us with those rubber wrists, only defends. Boooo!
works it off his pads behind square leg. Too easy, even at Fergie's pace

falls into the trap! New Zealand had a leg gully lurking. They were going to attack SS with the short ball. They were hoping he'd flick one in the air and this guy can grab it. But this is a full blooded pull shot. This is coming off at a zillion miles an hour. And it's not even right at the fielder. A fielder who's already dropped two catches. Guptill doesn't care though. He spots the ball early enough. He dives to his left quickly enough. Sticks out his hand and comes up with an absolute specy! This is going to be one of the catches of the tournament. Smith's copped the end of two of those now and New Zealand are now nice and snug in the driver's seat. The broadcast graphics say Guptill was only 17 m away from the batsman. Also, in terms of reaction time, he only had 0.6 seconds to pull off that miracle. #WOAH!
back of a length and outside off at 90 mph, Stoinis pushes into the covers

width on offer and Stoinis whacks it away towards the point boundary. There's protection there. And he's quality too. Only Boult has the ball climbing along his forearms like a ramp instead of sticking in his palms and the fumble leads to a boundary
googly to start and I'm not sure Khawaja picks it. Reaches out to defend and is comfortably beaten
resorts to the sweep straight away - which gives a batsmen who isn't reading the turn a little more margin for error - and takes a ball on a length on off stump for a trip to fine leg
stands up tall and punches the shortish delivery outside off to long-off
whips a loopy ball on off stump to long-on
smoothly done by Stoinis as he gets back and across to a short and wide ball and cuts to the sweeper
stays back to a good length ball outside off and slices it in front of point
short ball meets soft hands, little tap into the off side and a rapid run to put the icing on the cake
stands in the way of a 144 kph delivery and its date with middle stump

gooooooorrrrrge! Who cares if it's coming in at 150 clicks? Who cares if it's not a half-volley. It's wide enough. I can free my arms. I've got the powah. Now watch me as I cover drive the heck outta this
good length, outside off, no shot

bounces him and Stoinis can't get out of the way. How can he when it's 148 kph? He tries to ride it, getting up off his toes to drop the ball by his feet, but it still keeps climbing on him, takes the shoulder of the bat and lobs over to where short third man might have been
144 kph bouncer angled at the body but Khawaja sees it early and lets it go
over mid-on! Stoinis sees one tossed up and knows it's just got to go. Lunges forward and whacks it down the ground and gets just about lucky enough to beat a leaping KW at the 30-yard circle
brings down the flight a bit, but still keeps the length full. The bigger adjustment is in the line, dragging it outside off, and making sure Stoinis can only drive through the covers
drags it short and Khawaja has all the time in the world, and then some, to pull to deep square leg
zips in off the pitch looking for lbw, but Stoinis brings the bat down in time, and importantly it's straight. Sodhi's doing very well here
slow legbreak, drifting in on middle stump. Stoinis goes for the inside out drive to short cover
flatter trajectory outside off, Stoinis goes back to cut to cover point
keeps thudding 140+ kph deliveries into the deck, hoping to catch the batsman on the hop. Khawaja though won't be tempted into such silly situations
works the length ball on middle to short midwicket.
lovely shot to cross 1000 runs in 2019. Stands tall against a back of a length delivery outside off and flays it behind point

caaatcch, they cry... Williamson's the fielder, running up and to his left from mid-off. Goes for the dive. He's aaaaaalmost there. The hands reach out. Has he taken it? Have NZ done it again? Nooooo. The captain comes up and shakes his head. It's fallen short of him. Stoinis lives to drive on the up again
bouncer outside off, no shot from Stoinis

searing yorker to end the over, one that keeps coming in with the angle into the right-hander. Stoinis is alert enough to prevent it from rendezvousing with the stumps. That's drinks and this is very very fun.
pitches the googly short enough that the left-hander can go back, read the turn off the pitch and tap it into the covers
a little too leg side this time, inviting the sweep shot and Khawaja is only too happy to oblige. Gets it nice and fine
shapes to sweep again, but the ball is a little too full, and a little too far outside off and so he has to adjust and tap it back to the bowler with a straight bat
crunches the short ball turning away from him through cover point. Good footwork from Khawaja, used the depth of the crease perfectly

doesn't read the googly and has to weather and lbw appeal. Would've been going down though. Sodhi pitches it on middle and the right-hander is setting up to hammer it through the off side, going deep in his crease, and it lands him in a bit of trouble
drills a tossed up ball outside off to long-off
flicks a shortish delivery on the pads to midwicket
full and outside off, he drives to mid-off
lovely flowing drive off the front foot, but he can't beat point.
full and wide, tempting the drive away from the body - this is starting to look like a plan with a gully in place and most of the fielders on the off side - Khawaja doesn't play at it this time
full and a lot closer to his body, allowing him to use a straight bat and hit to mid-off
another lovely hit, opening the face of the bat to try and get the gap to the right of mid-off. KW won't allow it
tentative block - and it's all because of that lovely loop from Sodhi. He's in good rhythm today. No long hops. And practically everything in that dangerous off stump line, spinning both ways
slices it through cover point
stays back to deal with a length ball on middle behind square leg. Quick hands. Seriously quick hands
uses his reach to get to the pitch of the ball outside off and drive to long-off. Lovely contest brewin, fellas.

doesn't pick the googly and what's worse, he follows the ball turning the wrong way with his hands. With slip in place, that's quite dangerous. This time though Khawaja is able to keep the ball along the ground to point
strays onto his pads and he sends it away to fine leg
walks right across his stumps and gets struck on the pads as he tries to flick the ball through midwicket. Khawaja is trying to one-up NZ's 6-3 off side field
eases the shortish delivery outside off to third man
full and very very wide outside off and he'll have to re-bowl that
looks for the on the up drive but the 135 kph ball, on a good length and outside off, sticks in the pitch and bounces awkwardly on Khawaja. So much that he yanks the bottom hand away

with the batsman going so far across his stumps, Neesh tries to sneak a leg-stump yorker and take him out. Gets close but not close enough. Puts his hand on his mouth and the eyes bug out after the plan fails
slashes a good length ball outside off to deep point

caught behind! Neesh delivers an absolute peach. A cross-seamer that hits the deck. The line is close enough to off stump. The length though is in-between. Not full enough for the drive. Not short enough for the cut. Stoinis presses forward gamely, looking to block the ball out. But it's mischief not done yet. It decks away off the pitch, takes the outside edge and settles in the keeper's gloves. Top stuff.
full ball, angles into him from around the wicket, and he defends this, pressed forward
slants across him, and he cuts this fine. The backspin puts it beyond the reach of Lockie Ferguson at the deep point fence
down the legside. He looks for the sweep, and it goes down for four. Given wides, as it started from beyond leg and turned further away
tossed up, and he drives it back with the turn to the bowler
goes back and tucks this away with the turn towards long leg
angles into him from around the wicket, and he defends
quicker ball, slants down the leg side, and he looks to glance this. Gets it off the pad towards fine leg
full, on the pads, and he plays it towards wide mid on. Wants a single, but that went too quickly for them to get that much time. Sent back by the non-striker
full, on to the pads, and he drives it towards the wide mid off

WHAT A CATCH! If you thought Guptill had one of the rippers for the day, Jimmy Neesham has just sent in his nomination for moment of the day! It comes off the bottom of Maxwell's blade as he looks to pull a short one outside off, and Neesham dives away to his left and picks up a one-handed grab. That's the kind of catch you would be tempted to take out for dinner, and take home to introduce to your parents. New Zealand are on fire!
full, angling across him, and he plays it towards point
full, and gorgeous cover drive. Just a bit of foot movement, but fast hands that carry this blitzing through the off side field
length, angles into him and down the pads and whipped away towards long leg
length ball, turns into the batsman, who sweeps this towards long leg
length, and he plays it late off the keeper's gloves down towards third man
length, turns in from outside off, and strikes him on the pads as he looks to drive this. Not given! Will they review this? Williamson decides not to
length, turns into him, and he plays it with the tide towards short midwicket
reverse sweep pulled out to a length ball just outside off. Gets it square enough to beat short third man, and fine enough to beat backward point
big turn again, from outside off, and takes the pads on its way through to short third man
full, wide, and he has a swish at it, but misses

DROPPED! There's actually a slip now for Khawaja, and it eludes him too after coming off Latham's gloves. So unlucky for Neesham! Extra bounce from a length, and he looks to bail out of a drive, but gets it off the outer edge. It flies towards Latham's left, and he gets a glove to it, but can only pop it up behind himself
length, angles across him, as he leaves
length, outside off, and he defends
length, straight enough for him to be able to nurdle this away towards midwicket
shorter, slower through the air at 132kph, and he flicks it away towards long leg
tossed up outside off, and he looks for the reverse paddle, but cannot beat short third man
fuller, and he pulls out the reverse paddle. Gets it wide of short third man, and they are able to pick up two before backward point can mop up
full, turns into him, and he drives this down towards long on
full, towards leg stump, and he sweeps, but cannot beat the man at 45 degrees on the on side
looks to advance down the pitch, and Santner sees that and fires this wider. Forced to defend
sweeps a full ball from off stump towards long leg. Almost a horizontal bat drive along the floor
length, angles across him, and he defends. Off the inside of his bat on to his pads
length, stops on him a bit, as he looks to check his drive. Floats in the air, but goes through the vacant cover region towards sweeper cover
full, outside off, and stops a bit on the pitch again. He drives, and it comes off the inside of the bat back towards the bowler
length, angles across him at 134kph, and he defends this close to the body
length, and he shimmies across to the off side and paddles this away towards long leg
SHOT! Full, and he leans into a beautiful cover drive. There's a sweeper cover, but he can only admire this as it runs across to his left
full, and he drives this towards cover
length, angles away at 143kph, and he runs this down to third man
full, wide, and he cracks another lovely cover drive. Just timing, and placement...nothing more...
shorter, angles across him after pitching outside leg, and he defends from the crease
short, angles towards his pads from outside leg, and he tucks a 141kph ball away towards short midwicket
length, angles across him, and he defends. This was bowled at 149kph, as Ferguson continues to crank it up
full ball, angles away and he drives it back down the pitch
length, angles away and he pushes it just wide of Williamson at cover and picks up a single
length, straight, and he drives it back down the pitch
full, a bit wider, and he drives this through covers towards the sweeper stationed there now
length, angles away and he defends this
length, straighter, and he drives it back to the bowler. Delivered at just 126kph
short, down the leg side and he plays it down with a flick of the wrists towards long leg
short, angles across him from outside leg, and he defends as the line tucks him up
short ball, lifts off at 149kph, and Carey has to duck out of the way! Not dissimilar to the ball that dismissed David Warner!
length, angles away, and he defends this towards point
short, again homing in towards the batsman's face. Carey drops it with his glove, just fending off his helmet. Well played in the end
fuller, on the pads, and he flicks this away towards long leg. Ready for the variation in length - excellent batting!
length, outside off, and he drives this to covers
full, and he drives, but cannot beat Williamson at covers
fuller, and he whips it away from outside off, but cannot beat short midwicket
full, angles away and he runs it towards backward point with a flourish of his wrists
fuller length, angles away from him, and beats him with the line! Carey plays inside the line of this, and it just evades the outside edge. Well bowled!
full, and he drives this handsomely past mid off. Terrific shot!
tosses it up outside off from round the wicket, Khawaja jams the bat down on it and sends it to cover

nicks past the keeper! If KW's getting spin off a pitch, you know it ain't straight forward. Khawaja is drawn into the drive. The ball dips in front of him, messing up his timing. Then it turns, securing the outside edge
full and outside off, smears it through the covers
premeditates a scoop and has to deal with a ball well outside off - the kind he has been cover driving for four like a boss. Here though, he has to settle for a single to fine leg
attempts a drive away from the body and gets a thick outside edge to short third man
lovely wrists as he waits on the tossed up ball on middle and whips it to long-on
beautiful shot to raise a tough fifty! Shuffling inside the line of a short ball - a short ball at CdG's pace is zero threat - and flicks it behind square leg. Good manipulation of the field
stays back and blocks the shortish delivery outside off

neat flick round the corner as Khawaja waits on the ball to come to him. Seems effortlessly doing that when the ball is in line with the stumps, but whenever the ball is wider of off stump, he seems to go at it too hard and too soon
opens the face at the last second to slice a back of a length delivery to the left of backward point
punches the ball looking for the top of off stump to long-off. That's drinks
loads up the sweep and gets to the ball on the full, dragging it from middle stump to short fine leg
the ball is way outside off but Carey still reaches it with the sweep, hitting it over the top at midwicket
full on middle, Khawaja blocks
short and wide outside off, Khawaja rocks back to cut to deep point
beats him with a very slow ball outside off. Carey is looking to hit this too hard through the covers and is good enough to keep that back leg pegged in the ground. Good take from Latham as well
full and outside off, steers it to the sweeper. This is a very good stand from two relatively unheralded batsmen in this line-up. But seriously, Carey shouldn't be batting so low!
back of a length and outside off, taps it to cover
opens the face to try and get the gap behind point. No such luck
works the back of a length delivery on middle to short midwicket

superb hit! And it's because he is basically pulling a good length ball outside off. You know, the kind you're told to bowl in Test cricket. Only here, this extremely talented left-hander picks up the length so early and also takes the extra credit points as well by hitting with a relatively straight bat to send the ball skimming past wide mid-on (can't cross-bat those balls because they're not short enough)
opens the face and slices the shortish ball outside off to third man
slinks back to cut a shortish delivery outside off. Can't beat the field

risky run, Guptill's on it, Khawaja's in trouble.... no direct hit! Khawaja wants a single after mistiming the cut shot. He's too early on it and the slow pace of KW makes the bat face close and the ball go to cover. Guptill moves quickly enough to his right, takes aim at the non-strikers' end, couldn't hit the target
makes room to slide the shortish dleivery through cover point
pushes it through on middle, he defends
full on off stump, he drives smoothly to long-off
backs away and cuts the shortish delivery through to the sweeper

outrageous! This is an attempted bouncer outside off. So pulling it carries risk. But Carey manages it beautifully by leaping off his feet, getting on top of the ball and hammering it away through wide mid-on.
tucks him up with a back of a  length ball on middle. Defends
blocks a back of a length delivery to point

streaky shot but a super cool fifty. Looks to drive a wide ball outside off through the covers but ends up with an inside edge past the keeper. Deserves that luck. He's played with a lot of skill and no shortage of punch. Made Australia's quickest World Cup fifty earlier this tournament. Following it up with another lovely little innings
back of a length and outside off, spears it through to the sweeper
gets up with the short ball outside off and pulls it down to deep square leg. Good technique, playing it on top of the bounce and rolling the wrists to keep it down
beats him as Khawaja once again plays too far away from his body without moving his front foot across
stays back to try and cut a ball that isn't quite short enough and is beaten again
fullish and outside off, he plays from the crease and slices it to cover
full on off stump, Khawaja plays a little inside the line because of KW's drift, and the turn secures the outside edge to point
loops it up outside off and Khawaja unleashes a flowing drive to the sweeper
presents the inside out drive to long-off
looks to flick a shortish ball on leg stump through square leg, but is into the shot a touch too early. And no wonder. This is only at 141 kph. Fergs bowls 150.
hangs back and pulls a short ball outside of at 145 kph to short midwicket.
waits on the short ball outside off and carves it behind point. Guptill is there and he gets a hand on it to parry it towards third man
defends a good length ball on off stump to point

unreal! Ferguson loves bowling short. He's had success bowling short. But this is only 142 kph. And it's only above waist high. All of that essentially means it's in Carey's wheelhouse and he just stands tall and slams it over deep midwicket #LikeABoss
shortish on off stump, pushes into the covers
very very full - so much that it becomes a low full toss on middle. Khawaja drives to long-off

edged but safe. Williamson has been teasing the left-handers with a lot of flight. Drawing them into the drive outside off. Carey's sucked into the trap, gets a very thick nick, Latham follows it, staying down and getting up with the ball, but he can't grab it in the end
sweeps to midwicket
shortish and outside off, he rocks back and cuts to deep point
width again and Khawaja slaps it to the left of backward point
half an lbw appeal but Boult bails out of it. Would've gone down. Decent straight though. The ball on a good length and nipping into Carey, who wasn't expecting that as he plays the flick
nudges the length ball on middle to midwicket
and now he's playing all the orthodox stuff. The picture perfect off drive. Placed to the right of Williamson. Amazing timing on a pitch that isn't suiting such shots
good length outside off, he drives to mid-off
shortish and outside off, slices to the sweeper
looks to flick a fuller delivery on leg stump to fine leg. But only ends up making contact with the pad
tossed up outside off, and he drives but cannot beat point
flighted outside off, and he drives back to the bowler
leans back and cuts a length ball outside off away towards deep backward point
flatter, outside off, and he swats it away towards deep midwicket
goes back and drives it towards point
was that dropped? Too full for the cut, as he backs away and looks to get it through the offside. Goes through to Latham, but no great reactions from the bowler. Seems to be have been just a bad miss
length, and he drives it but cannot beat mid off
length, and the ball stops on Carey as he looks to drive this down the ground. Not able to time this well at all
length, and he drives this past covers. Seems like a change of pace, but he picked it well. That also brings up the 100-run partnership
fuller ball, a hint of reverse back into him, as he biffs this off the inside of the bat towards deep backward square leg
length, and he drives on the up, but cannot beat cover
full, outside off, and he opens up the face of his blade to run it towards deep point
short, and he goes back and cuts it towards deep backward point
short, and he cuts it towards deep point again
looks for the cheeky paddle sweep, and gets it towards fine leg. Aerial, but just beyond Latham
cuts this off the backfoot towards deep backward point
tossed up, and he flicks this with some quick wrists and fast hands towards square leg

OUT THIS TIME! A terrific hand from Alex Carey comes to an end, as he looks to go inside out over cover but cannot clear Martin Guptill. Smart work, too, from KW, as he continues to get some purchase and grip from this surface. Nonetheless, this partnership has brought Australia right back into this contest
back of a length, angles across him and he steers it down to third man
length, and he pokes it down to third man. There's a slip in place for Cummins now
short, and he ducks inside the line of this
fuller, slower (if that's possible) and angles across him. Just 122kph, and he taps it towards point
short, and well directed. Forced to take evasive action for the second time in the over. Angles across his body
drives a fuller ball towards sweeper cover
starts with a googly, which he drives to covers
tossed up, around the middle stump, and he whips it away towards deep midwicket
wrong 'un, on a good length, and he defends from the crease
tossed up, with Ross Taylor at first slip, but Cummins stretches and drives this down to long off
reverse lap, and does well to get it over the infield. Through the point fence, and he simply had to time it well enough
floated close to off stump, and he flicks it with the turn towards deep midwicket
wide outside off from Ferguson, and he slashes this through point. Great shot, as he uses the 136kph on offer on that ball to get it behind square
full, fast and he drives this down to long on
short, and well-directed again! This was 143kph, and Cummins was caught in two minds. Wanted to come forward, and suddenly forced to duck by the angle of that sharp, incoming delivery
slower ball, outside off, and he stays rooted in the crease and sees that beat the outside edge. Bowled at 114kph
short, angles into him at 145kph and he ducks under this
fuller, outside off, and he drives this to point, and takes the single on offer
floats this wide outside off, and beats a swat from Cummins
length, and he goes towards deep midwicket. Could have had four, but for Jimmy Neesham, who fields this down to his left
length, and he goes inside out. Drops short of long off
tossed up outside off, and he goes for it down the ground. Takes the leading edge, and this time it lands just short of long on!
length, and he swings this towards deep midwicket. To the right of Neesham, who nonchalantly knocks this back into play with his right hand. Superb fielding, but vital runs for Australia!
length, wide outside off, and he slaps this down to long off
wide outside off, and he drives this towards sweeper cover
precise yorker. Swings a bit late into him, and he can only dig it out towards cover
gets lucky! Charges down to a fuller ball again, and with the late reverse swing, it takes the inside edge and runs fine past Latham
backs away, and Boult shortens the length. Wants to go over point, but misses out on contact
swings into him from a full length, and he takes it on the full and drops it down towards long leg
short ball, and he moves away to the leg side and ramps it down towards third man. Cheeky!
backs away to the legside and biffs a full ball down towards long on
full, outside off, and he guides a 143kph ball towards deep point
short, and he ducks under it. Decides late to try and run it down towards third man, but that had already passed him by then
short, and he drop-kicks this, one bounce towards long leg
full toss, outside off, and he looks to drive this down the ground. Outside edge runs it down to the right of third man, and they scurry through for the second

full toss, and this time he has pierced the infield! Backs away, and even takes the bottom hand as he muscles this through cover, and too fast for sweeper at the point fence to get to it. What a hand this is from Cummins...
low full toss, swinging back in, and he drives it down to long off. Bowled at 144kph
fuller ball, around the stumps, and he can only tap it towards short midwicket

GONE THIS TIME! Perfect full ball again, delivered at 137kph, and with a hint of reverse again back in from outside off. Khawaja walks across to access the on side, but misses out on contact and in fact walks right outside the line of the ball. Vital half-century from Khawaja, though, as he acknowledges the crowd on his way out

OH YOU BEAUTY! We might get to see a bit of this from Starc later -- a perfect yorker, that swings in at good pace and goes under his blade even as he looks to jam it down. Almost as good as the ball that Starc delivered to Ben Stokes just a few days ago!

HE'S GOT IT! Full, swinging away from him after pitching around leg, and given. Australia have reviewed this! It's a perfect full length, and there's no sign of bat near that. The only question could be where it pitched, I would think. The bat hits ground, but that is after the ball passes through and crashes into his right foot. It's out, and that's a hat-trick for Trent Boult!
full, wide outside off, and he looks to back away to get this down to fine leg, but misses. Almost got FOUR IN FOUR!

sweetly timed to the left of mid-off. Good signs for Guptill, who sometimes seems suspect against left-arm quicks because of the ball coming back in. This one though just pitches on a length and carries on with the angle, allowing him to play that favourite on the up drive
nicely behind the 132 kph delivery looking for the top of off stump
looks for the flick through square leg but ends up with a welt on his thigh (probably)
half a shout for lbw as Nicholls is stuck in his crease against one that nips back into him off a length. Miiiiiight just be too high
stands up nice and tall behind the shortish delivery on off stump and blunts it
covers the line well and, it seems, he's started to move his feet as well. Gets across to off stump to get behind the short ball
starts with a short ball across the right-hander at 143 kph. Keeps the slips interested. Not the batsman though
cuts back in! Like a left-arm legbreak! Hits on and around off stump and then veers into Guptill, who is thinking he has an easy leave and in the end is struck on the thigh

should I leave, should I play? Should I even try? This is testing bowling from Australia's strike weapon. He gets his radar perfect. On and around off stump and that last ball jagging back so far is still playing on Guptill's head as he steps forward to play something in between a leave and a block
good stuff, Guppy! Waits for the short ball outside off, taps it gently on top of the bounce and says, Henry, you deal with Starc
slants into the pads at 152 kph and Nicholls, shuffling across his stumps, is hit on his pads. Would have gone down though

dangerous ball! It's the one that he slings out towards the off side but in mid-air it curls back into the left-hander. Essentially the same one Stokes got. Except it isn't a yorker and perhaps that's why Nicholls is able to block it from crashing into his sticks
crunches the back of a length delivery outside off behind point.
good length on off stump, Guptill keeps it out. Hmm. Might be jumping the gun but Behrendorff isn't getting much movement. And he's known for that
pitches it right up there, almost on yorker length, Guptill drives to cover
very tight lines from Behrendorff. Guptill gets forward and defends a ball heading on to off stump
screams away through the covers. Guptill gets the room to free his arms and he's calm enough to slap it through the gap
bowler overcompensates for the mistake and goes down the leg side
hints of movement into the right-hander but Guptill is able to nudge it between midwicket and mid-on. Good connection because he wasn't trying to hit it too hard
onto him too quickly as he tries to flick the back of a length ball on middle behind square leg. Beaten for (142kph) pace
gets it to hold its line at 151kph and Guptill does well, watching the ball all the way, getting squared up a touch so he can defend a ball pitching leg and moving away
dangles it outside off. Guptill won't bite
goes searching for that inswinging delivery to take out Guptill's stumps. But the 145 kph veers off target
back of a length and outside off, no need to bother with those. Just wave to the 152 kph white thing flying by
keeps out a good length ball at 147 kph looking for middle and leg stump. Who wants to be an opening batsman, eh?

half an appeal from Starc as he gets a length ball to curl back into Guptill at pace. The right-hander is trapped. His front foot is too far across and he doesn't have the time to adjust. Only height saves him. These are nervy times.
strays on the pads and Guptill does the most decent thing that ball deserved. An all-expenses paid trip to the fine leg boundary
goes back in his crease to block the 134 kph short ball on middle
137kph, punches the short if a length delivery outside off to point

un-play-ABLE! Guptill recoils from a ball that pitches on off stump, back of a length, one he thinks he has covered with a back foot block but one that nips away off the pitch like it's nobody's business
strong push into the covers, but that infield is definitely packed
touch too straight and the batsman is able to work it to square leg

beautiful straight drive. Made all the more better by the fact the speedgun says this is 153 kph. Nicholls gets in line and presents the full face so that a ball looking to take over his stumps instead crashes into the boundary boards
that's his shot. The flick off the hips. He plays it with his eyes closed and with one hand making the Spock sign. Too straight. Touch too short. Simply put away

146 kph - no one bowls a full delivery at the stumps like Starc. That curl away when the ball leaves his hand. The curl in as it travels the pitch. Nicholls is aware of the danger and is playing with as straight a bat as possible
bouncer on off stump, lets it go, ump says it's too high
off the shoulder of the bat to point as Nicholls tries to get on top of a rising delivery on off stump. The only problem is it keeps rising.
154 kph scorcher!. Could be the fastest ball of the Cup. But he picks the line early and lets go a good length ball outside off.
147kph, full on off stump, Nicholls brings that bat down well in time
144 kph on a good length and outside off. Guptill lets it run off the outside half of the bat to third man
gets just enough movement away from the bat as Nicholls steps forward to defend a fuller delivery on off stump. Bit of an outside edge to point
good leave. Relies on that a lot in Test cricket. And here too, he covers the stumps to be safe from the ball nipping back in, which in this case is wise because it does just that
bouncer which is allowed to climb over Nicholls' shoulder and go through to the keeper. Good stuff from Nicholls. Looks like he belongs. In a World Cup game. Against Australia.

pins him on the pad as Cummins gets his line perfect with the indipper. But it might just have been too high. Certainly was too quick for him as he gets his front leg too far across and gets caught with the bat having to come around it
fullish on off stump, defends to cover

huuuge appeal for lbw as Behrendorff gets one to pitch on leg stump and nip in just the slightest bit. Guptill is caught with his front foot in the wrong place. The bat needs to come down around it and it can't make the journey in time. Australia think about the review, but they don;t go for it in the end. Worried about it going down leg, was Behrendorff and so Finch didn't go for it. Replays show it would have been umpire's call on hitting the stumps
fullish and outside off, defends
good length and outside off, taps it towards point
definite movement at this end for Behrendorff, Another lbw ball, pitching on middle and leg and nipping in at the right-hander. Guptill this time is able to get an inside edge
pitches it up and tests both edges of the bat. Guptill is good enough to plant the middle of it on the ball though

he almost falls over himself because of the late inswing, but because he is switched on, he's able to flick the ball on leg stump away through midwicket. NZ know they're in a fight. They know these first few overs are the biggest threat.
solid defensive push from Guptill, into the covers
that was there! It was there for the Marty G slap over point. And he does go for it, backing away and giving it his all. But the Cummins bouncer beats him for pace
another bouncer this time angled into the right-hander. Guptill evades it
full and curling into him. Guptill keeps his bat straight and pushes to mid-on
defends a good length ball outside off towards point
fluent drive to mid-off, Guptill daring to put a little bit of his power into this shot because it's an overpitched delivery on middle
beautyyyyyy. Kisses the deck on middle and nips away from the bat, whistling over the off stump as it goes to the keeper.

strangled down leg. And he's walking off. A poor end to what looked like a promising innings as he tries to pull a short ball down to fine leg but in the end only gloves the ball through to the keeper
back of a length and darting away outside off. He lets it go

looks for the lbw with a pitched up ball on off stump. Williamson though is so very good at making sure that front leg never goes across. It only ever stays beside the line of the ball so he can bring down a straight bat, which in this case helps an inside edge scurry away through square leg
good length on off stump, defends
ignores a ripe delivery on off stump, perfect for the on the up drive, and also for the nick behind. Ooooh, this is tense
length ball, angles in, and he plays it away towards square leg
length, outside off, and he taps it down with a typical KW dead bat
jaffa! A good length, just outside off, and moves away a touch off the seam, and goes past his outside edge as he looks to defend
length, outside off, and he is able to run a 144kph ball down towards third man
short, and angles into him as it goes through to Carey. A half-appeal...may have just brushed his hip
length, hits the pitch really hard, and he presses forward to defend this
length, outside off, and he just stands up tall and punches this towards extra cover. Beautiful!
length, angles across him, and he defends
length, and he drops it with a dead bat and responds to Guptill's call for a quick single before point can swoop in on that
fuller, angling across him, and he drives it towards mid off
fuller, angles across him, and he plays it past Maxwell at point and they get through for a comfortable single. Would have taken him on anyway, as that was travelling to his right
length, straight, and he ticks it over towards deep midwicket this time
length ball, turns in, and he defends from the crease
fuller, angles across him, and he flicks it past short leg towards square leg
gets down on one knee and slaps a length ball down towards long leg
length, around off stump, and he defends
fuller, a bit quicker at 88kph, and he goes back and defends this
fuller, angles into him, and he plays this with a dead bat towards Finch at short leg

full ball, angles into him, and given out leg before! Guptill chooses to walk. A bit of swing as it comes back into him. He gets his front foot around in front and cannot bring his bat down on time as he overbalances a touch. Behrendorff strikes again by bowling full. This is a vital breakthrough for the Australians
length ball, angles across him, flies off the shoulder of the bat towards third man!
length, nips away after pitching outside off, and he drops his wrists and sees it through to the keeper
a little short, and he jumps and tries to flick this away towards fine leg. Hits him on the thigh pad and drops at the wicket
fuller, on the pads, and he tries to flick this towards long leg. Came off the thigh pad!
fuller, and he drives it back, but Behrendorff fields
tossed up, and he taps it to the right of point and picks up a single
length, turns into him, and comes off his pads and pops up. Lands short of short leg anyway
fuller, and he pulls out the sweep. A fielder in the deep for that, and he runs to his right and sends in a flat return
length, turns into him, and he flicks this towards short midwicket
outside off, and he looks to defend this towards point. Very feeble touch, along the ground, fielded by slip

DROPPED? Tossed up outside off, and he saw his chance to drive against the turn. May have taken a bit of the bat, and part of Carey's right pad through to first slip, where the fielder fails to hold on. Steve Smith in position there
length, straightens into him, and he drives it back to the bowler
length and he defends outside off. Goes off towards point
length, and he drops it dead at his feet
length, and he cuts this but cannot beat point
fuller, and he drives but skews it a bit as it ends up going back off the inside of the bat back towards Behrendorff
length, on his pads, and he flicks this off his hips towards long leg
tossed up, and holds its line, and beats the outside edge
turn into him from a length, and he flicks this down towards fine leg
tossed up, and he defends this outside his off stump
tossed up, and he flicks this from outside off, with the turn, but cannot beat short midwicket
looks to sweep from outside off, and paddles it down towards fine leg. Risky, but effective!
quicker, straighter, and he defends this towards point
length, outside off, and he lashes this through covers. The sweeper will cut it off ahead of the fence, out to his right
length, jags back into him, and he drops it right by his eyes. Caught by surprise by a bit of extra bounce in that!

DROPPED! Difficult chance through to Carey. This one from Behrendorff was an off-cutter, and moved away from Williamson, who chased it through. Off the toe-end, and dying on Carey, who gets a bit of a finger on it as it runs away from him towards third man
slower ball again, angles across Taylor, who reads it and defends this to point
length, angles across and he defends this towards point
length, angles into him and he plays it towards square leg
tossed up, and turns away from him. Beats the outside edge as he tries to drive
full toss, and he smacks it out towards sweeper cover
flatter, pitches around leg and strikes him on the pad. Didn't turn back in enough, and probably also pitched outside leg
full toss again, and he drives this towards deep point. Great stuff from Starc there
another full toss, another shot straight to the sweeper deep on the off side
tossed up more, and he drives it well enough to get it past cover
short, and too short according to the umpires. Also slanted away from him
length, angling away, and he dabs it down towards third man
slower ball, but sprays it down the leg side
length, and straight along the line across from leg to off, and he has to block this
length ball, defends towards short midwicket
slower ball, traps him on the pads as he shuffles across. Not given leg before, and Australia seem to believe that could have pitched outside leg. Another off-cutter
fuller ball, and slower through the air again at just 120kph, and he plays it towards mid on
length, and he cuts it down to third man
steps down the track to drive a tossed up ball to long-on
loads up the sweep as the ball slides into leg stump. Plays too early and cue-ends the ball towards midwicket
defends a flatter delivery on middle stump. Getting just a little grip is the Aussie captain
steps down the pitch to try and whip the ball against the turn through midwicket, but turn is what Finch does, beating the closed face and hitting his pad
sweeps past short fine leg, the desperate dive doesn't work and New Zealand get a little bit of relief. Poor ball well down leg. Simple putaway, no fuss. And on we go
full on middle, drives to long-off
shapes to pull the back of a length ball on leg stump but it doesn't quite come on and he mistimes it to the left of the keeper
misfield at midwicket - Carey, I think - and it allows Williamson to sneak a second after a well played tap, right under his eyes
blocks a back of a length delivery on off stump
slinks across his stumps to bully a good length ball outside off into the hands of deep square leg
opens the face as he meets a shortish ball outside off, looking for a single to third man, but backward point hasn't been clued in on that plan

gets it to dart away - the legcutter gripping off the pitch - and Taylor follows the ball, steering it to third man with soft hands .Still risky though. A little extra bounce and he could have been caught behind
tosses it up on off stump, Taylor pushes it back down the pitch
gently pats the flighted delivery on off stump into the off side
quicker through the air but still very full on off stump. Taylor works it to midwicket. Pressure keeps building
nudges a full ball on the pads behind square leg
spots the length early, goes back and waits for the ball to turn, and only then does he tap it through square leg for a simple single
lovely placement. Taylor plants the ball between midwicket and deep square leg with a simple nudge off the pads and his partner is awake to the second run
stands tall behind a shortish delivery outside off and turns it to mid-on
inside edge onto his boot as he tries to dab the ball to third man

lifts it over deep midwicket. A length ball on leg stump and Williamson decides to show off a bit. Sure I could have nudged it along the ground to square leg. Buuuuuut.... I'd rather hit the first six of the day. There! Boom!
back of a length and outside off, dabs it behind point
bottom edge scurries away past the right of the keeper. Williamson is trying the punch through cover but he's happy for the two nonetheless
chops the back of a length ball to the right of the keeper
looms over the tossed up ball outside off and flicks it through midwicket
plenty of flight, luring KW into a hard-hit cover drive that bursts through the hands at short cover to bring up 6000 ODI runs. The third fastest to the mark, three innings behind Kohli
defends a tossed up delivery outside off. Maxi's getting lovely drift now.
over mid-off and into the boundary. Sure the ball is turning into him, but he gets a good stride going and there's plenty of width to free the arms
taps it towards point
turns the length ball on leg stump through square leg
slaps the short and wide delivery at 147 kph right through point, the timing good enough to draw the mistake from the fielder
151kph, tucks a fullish delivery on leg stump through midwicket and they scurry across for the second as well.

caught behind. One genius gets the other! And it's that dab. It's the go to shot. It's the one that feeds every one of his ODI innings. But not this one. The ball angling across the right hander - a cutter set up for the fourth slip - takes the edge as KW plays the dab and goes through to the keeper. Australia celebrate. Starc celebrates although should he reallly? He keeps taking so many wickets in his first over of a new spell that maybe he should just yawn and wave bye-bye to the other guy
145 kph and it's coming at his throat. Latham tries to lift it over midwicket but he is far far too slow with the shot
flicks the full, inswinging delivery at 152 kph to deep square leg
closes the face too early and gets a leading edge through cover point. Gorgeous bowling from Lyon, round the wicket, drifting it into the left-hander and getting it to turn away, sharply
full and outside off, he smears it to the sweeper.
goes for the sweep and makes good enough connection for a couple to fine leg
good length ball outside off, no shot
works a tossed up ball on off stump, against the turn, to deep midwicket

oooh, the dip ruins the drive. How often does Lyon do that. He lures the right-hander into driving against the turn, through the off side. And then dupes them in the air. Here the ball drops on Taylor, massively, and gets his inside edge onto pad
150kph back of a length and outside off, blocks to cover point
good length, outside off, no shot
148kph, goes for the bouncer on middle but Latham is happy to stand behind it and block
leading edge as Starc dials down the pace to a gentle 140 kph and has the batsman flicking through midwicket way too early.
rides the bounce nicely and steers the 149 kph delivery outside off to third man
looks for that deadly yorker - only this one's a mere 143 kph and well outside off - Taylor bunts it to cover point
tosses it up on off stump, defends
short and wide, Latham slaps it past the right of cover
top edge but it doesn't carry to short fine leg. There's the danger playing the sweep to an offspinner that is known for his turn and bounce
full and outside off, drives back to the bowler
direct hit, has Latham made it?. Ohh this is tight. And he just about gets in. Good dive. Full length. Bat grounded. Well done. So Taylor's little nudge to Maxwell is good enough
goes back to the length ball, opening up his hips so the bat can come down on top of the ball for a single to square leg
mis-hit as Latham brings his bat across, looking for a run through midwicket, but instead gets a bit of a leading edge to cover
goes to pull a ball that isn't short enough or wide enough and ends up looking very very awkward. Not to mention the hit  to his body
back of a length and outside off, defends
good length on off stump, he defends
looks like an offcutter that grips and moves away from the left-hander. Latham is a bit squared up as he steers to third man
kicks off a length and Taylor is almost fearing a hit to his head. Just about gets the bat high up to knock the ball down to the leg side
fired in straight, and he flicks it away towards deep backward square leg
full, outside off, and he misses out on a dab down to third man
length, and he drives it back toward the bowler
reverse sweeps a length ball, and goes off the top edge of the back of the bat, but lands short of the fielder at point
intent shown, comes down the track and tries to drive him down the ground. Bat skews in his hand and goes toward midwicket
turned around the corner with the little turn into him towards deep midwicket
short, and he swings this around the dial to bissect the gap between fine leg and deep backward square leg. 1000 runs against Australia for Taylor
length, angles into him and he plays it with soft hands towards square leg and picks up a single
short, angles away from him, and he steers it down to third man

RUNS OUT OF PATIENCE! Fuller ball, and he looks to go across the line and top-edges this behind the wicket. It hangs in the air forever but Carey positions himself well and takes it low down in front of him. What a time for Australia to get rid of Taylor!
short, and he ducks underneath this. Bowled at 145kph!
length, and he presses forward and plays it to point

STICKS AND STONES MIGHT HURT HIS BONES, BUT BOOS WILL GET HIM A WICKET! He loops one up outside off, and CdG has hit this high and straight down Khawaja's throat at wide long off. What a shame, off the first ball too! Wicket for Smith!
bowls an off break, darting into him, and he flicks it away towards deep midwicket
off break again, now with a slip in place, and he defends
defends a length ball back to him
nice flourish of the arms as he bounds in and bowls another off break, and he presses forward to defend
straighter ball, and he taps it to the right of point and takes off
tossed up, and he runs it with the turn towards point
tossed up, angles into him, and he defends
tossed up, and he drives this but cannot beat point
tossed up, outside off, and he defends as it turns away from him
length, he waits for it to turn away from him, and then runs it along to point
runs a full ball down towards long off
length, and he taps it towards point
length, turns away sharply, and Neesham has to adjust late to defend this
turns again from a length, and he has to defend this back down the wicket
flighted, and he can drive this to the right of mid on
flighted outside off, and he sweeps this towards deep midwicket
flicks a length ball from off stump towards deep midwicket
length, and he runs this down towards third man
length, and he walks into a drive, but can only find point

WHAT A CATCH! Fuller ball, but Latham saw it and was eyeing the midwicket fence. Gets a good bit of the bat to it, and Superman Steve Smith flies away to his right and plucks it out with his right hand. Super stuff!
length, outside off, and he lets this pass
length, lifts off a length and he leaves this
short, lifter outside off at 145kph, and he plays it down towards point. They go through for a quick single
length, and he goes back to punch this down towards the bowler
presses forward to defend a length ball, tossed up on middle
length, goes on with the arm, and Santner didn't read it! Goes back and almost chops it on to his stumps
length, and he goes back and punches this out towards deep point
tossed up, and he fetches this from outside off and drags it towards cow corner. NCN fielding there as a sub will cut it off
tossed up, and he punches this towards extra cover
length ball, just on off stump, and goes on with the angle as Neesham plays inside the line. Narrowly misses both the outside edge and the top of off!
length, jags back into Neesham, who defends this towards point
shorter length, angles into him, and he fends it down towards square leg
full, outside off, and he drives this but can only get it to cover
full, and he shimmies across and flicks towards short midwicket. Had to scramble back as he was sent back! No direct hit, luckily for him, at the striker's end
short, and he jumps to fend this right in front of his face. Seems to have hit part of his helmet, after rising off the glove. Short, and swift!

swings across the line, and holes out to the bowler himself! Well, with the rise in required run-rate, this was always on the cards. Lyon flights one outside off, and Neesham tries to swing this across the line, and the top edge goes towards short midwicket. Lyon calls, and takes the catch himself
tossed up, and he defends this outside off
length, angles into him and straightens, and he defends this
goes back and punches a length ball down towards wide long off
length, and he whips it off his legs towards short midwicket
length, and he lobs this over short fine leg. Dismissive from Sodhi!
length, angles into him, and he defends
short, lifts away from outside off, and he takes the bat out of the line of that as it passes through to Carey
full ball, and he punches this towards cover
fuller, but strays down the pads, and he flicks this away towards deep backward square leg
fires in a 149kph yorker, and Sodhi does well to get it away towards short midwicket
tries a short ball, but sprays it down the leg side, and will have to bowl this once again
length, down the leg side, and it goes through the keeper with Sodhi looking to play it down the leg side. Called a wide, but the bowler had a half-appeal. And Finch also considered a review briefly

shapes into him from wide of the crease, and he has been caught in front of the crease. Called leg-before, but they review this. Nothing wrong with the front foot, and there doesn't appear to be any bat on it either. The impact is fine, and the wickets stay with umpire's call. That's Starc now emulating his haul of wickets from 2015!
tossed up, and the extra bounce beats Santner!
tossed up, and he drives this towards covers
OH, WHAT A TRY! Santner sashays down the pitch and smacks it, trying to clear David Warner at mid on. Warner hops to his right, sticks his left hand out, and almost pulls off an absolute beauty!
presses forward to defend a length ball
length ball, defended to point
big turn, from outside off, across the batsman, and past Carey as well. Called a wide
length, and he cuts this away towards point

BOWLED HIM! Starc always attacks the stumps, and this time he was too quick and too accurate for Ferguson. Wicket no. 23 as he comes from wide of the crease, and Ferguson fails to get behind the line of this
honing in on the off stump, but Boult gets his bat down on it on time
short, and he backs away in trying to go down the ground, but misses out
full, and he backs away again, but can get some bat on it. Plays it back towards Starc, who takes it on the bounce over his left shoulder
full, and he backs away again and gets it towards point
full, backs away and gets an inside edge towards fine leg. Carey stops it
length, turns and stays low. Santner wants to drive this back, but it sneaks under his bat
moves across and whacks this over deep backward square leg!
length, and he goes back and wants to pump this through midwicket. Gets close to the inside edge, and it beats Carey, the bat and the leg stump on its way through to the fine leg fence
tossed up, and he drives this through point
comes down the wicket and gets it towards long leg. They pick up two before the fielder there can come around to that position
comes down the wicket and has a mighty heave at it. Trickles down towards deep midwicket, and Santner refuses the single to take on Starc
length, fast, and he backs away and has a swing, and a miss...
full ball, and he looks to flick this down towards fine leg. Goes off the thigh, but he refuses a possible single
full ball, and he drives this towards cover

short, and he holes out to fine leg! Starc has five, and Australia have crushed New Zealand in an imposing performance where they were on the back foot for the first hour and a bit in this contest. Cricket, bloody hell! It was short and quick, and Santner actually got inside the line of the ball and was looking to hook this towards long leg. The pace on the ball took the top edge and made it go finer, and Behrendorff made no mistake
